message: The Startup Fix is a little project where I will take couple of hours per week of my own personal time to help a startup. I will do so by helping them on an aspect that I think is lacking in most of startups nowadays: the visual aspect. Logo, fonts, colours, layout, user interface, Twitter, Facebook, newsletters, call-to-actions, you name it.
If you have a startup and want to be a part of this, well here is your chance to submit your application. I am now taking applications for April 2011.
@kevinbedard Yep, sounds awesome. The only question is - where to I apply. :)
@kevinbedard  - I think you're going to get a lot of people that will be open to having you help out with one of their projects with this offer.  Count me in too.
Hey guys, you can apply on the website: http://www.thestartupfix.com - If you can't find the Call to action to apply, then I failed...litteraly! ;)
@keveinbedard Perhaps this isn't the place for it, but there's a slight typo on your home page "just get it fix" should be "just get it fixed."
@bmelton - Hey thank-you for the info, I had my website revised tonight by an english speaking person ;) Should be all good now!
looking forward to send in mine.
i might be missing some very obvious reference... but when you say "sees the day"... do you mean "seize the day"?
@hoke - haha, no I meant seeing the day, how shoudl that be spelled? see's? :( Thx
@kevinbedard: "See", as in "Thousands of people see the Statue of Liberty every Saturday."

@kevinbedard You mention considering putting tips/resources/etc. on the site... It would be interesting to see before & after blog posts on some of the projects that come through this, especially if the startup is willing to show the results via analytical data.
@jimrollenhagen - Yes Jim, posting a "study case" and shots of before and after of every startup I help is part of the plan. Thank-you :)
Sounds like a great idea.  I'm sure more people will want to get in on this.  If all goes well, you should consider expanding your 'fixers' beyond just your self.
